column5: Achievable: A certificate from Trojan Tackle to customize the down rigger mounts on the new boat not too likely - a pair of tickets to go Tarpon Fishing down Costa Rica way In March Impossible, but most wanted - one more xmas with my Mum and Dad, and FIL so the kids could remember them when they are older. We could share fishing tales and each other's company like we used to.

Manitoubass I live in the Vermilion Bay area,Egli's is in Minnitaki,right on the hwy 17 midway between Dryden & V-Bay They are not a franchise,they raise the sheep & have a small factory & store on the farm.
Well, if Santa is listening, I'd love a new Vexilar Flasher!!!
A new fish finder for the boat. Mine is dying.

A new minn kota all terrain if they still make them (not the electronic foot peddle). A couple deep cycle batteries thrown in with it. However, I already have the perfect wife that never questions my fishing decisions (that's how I see it anyways. LOL).

Fishing related I don't need a thing. But I wouldn't be getting it from Santa anyway.  I tell the kid's to save their money and not waste it on me. So I get a restaurant gift card or something like that and truthfully I'm happy as a clam.  So that's leaves Debbe. She has bought me 2 expensive  fishing related presents over the years. Both where returned. I have had about the same luck buying her cloths. So Santa Steve does NOT get Debbe cloths or anything remotely fashion related and Santa Debbe stays the hell out of the fishing section.  Works good for us.

I love my new socks and underwear every year. Honestly no sarcasm . I haven't bought underwear in 15 years. LOL. Santa gets me underwear every year. And my stocking always has a toothbrush, toothpaste and a small bottle of mouth wash.Some years I get razors and shaving cream.  Santa seems genuinely concerned about my hygiene  I think the last pair of underwear I bought was at Biway.  How long have they been gone?
I'd be happy with a trip to somewhere like here or here.   I'd actually settle for anywhere really.....
Santa already delivered my Xmas present (MHX 10ft steelhead hardware rod built by a buddy of mine)

My fishing gift wish won't be under the tree... After only getting our twice this fall for about 6hrs of chrome time. My wish is to get out with my dad and a buddy and see both of them catch some silver... Let's hope the weather cooperates!!!!

I love my new socks and underwear every year. Honestly no sarcasm . I haven't bought underwear in 15 years. Every year the boys get a couple of pair of Bass Pro socks, the ones torture tested by TJ.  You just can't seem to wear them out.
And even when you do, they replace them free of charge, no questions asked. Best socks ever!  S.
You just can't seem to wear them out.  Then why do they need new ones every year ??
Yup! My son has brought 2 pairs back thus far. The one time he was actually wearing them into the store when we made an unscheduled stop at BPS. I felt sorry for the poor guy behind the counter.
He exchanged his socks because they were dirty?
Mr.Buddy heater would be nice.  One can only ask.   Thanks for the chuckle Lew. Needed that.
id love a line counting trolling set up for lakers and/or a fly fishing rod and reel
A Hardy Zane TI  fly reel

My mom and dads old movie projector and a couple of reels and or the old projector with the rectangular slide trays ,,,,,,the one where you had to let the projector light cool down once in a while.  They had so many movies and slides of the older brothers and sisters and just a few of myself because I was still pretty young,  They were of countless family  fishing adventures thru Algonquin Park, Callender, Sudbury, Manitoulin, Parry Sound etc.  Dont know what happened to them but to have  them would mean more than anything store bought
They were holey and dirty. That boy's feet can curdle milk!

Have a empty rod that would fit a decent line counter reel.Looking for a lightly used,and my wife would never attempt to buy that for me. Little cash would work,depending on the amount heck,maybe even buy new??  .

I asked for a sheepskin hat.  If I get that I will be happy as a pig in ......  I left this page open on my wife's computer:http://eglifarm.com/product_info.php/cPath/22_60/products_id/78I always try and buy Canadian (or North American) if possible and this fits the bill. I hope she took the hint as she always give me trouble when she does the same and I drop the ball lol!!!Burt

I asked for a sheepskin hat.  If I get that I will be happy as a pig in ......  I left this page open on my wife's computer:  http://eglifarm.com/product_info.php/cPath/22_60/products_id/78  I always try and buy Canadian (or North American) if possible and this fits the bill. I hope she took the hint as she always give me trouble when she does the same and I drop the ball lol!!!  Burt Oh ya, that's a nice one, no feeling the wind with that on top of the noggin.

Egli's Sheep Farm is just down the road from me,I have one of their hats as do most people in the area (as well as mitts,slippers,boot liners etc. They put out a very high quality product.You will not be disappointed,providing Santa brings you 1
I have a lowrance elite 7 HDI under the tree righty now!!
where do ya live dood?  is eglis a franchise?
Guess we'd need a tree first...

Without going silly nuts, like finding a new 300 HP 4 stroke under the tree, what would be the one thing you would be trilled and amazed to find under there? I always get a few nice plugs and I'm both happy and appreciative. I just found Bill's Bait site on internet history, whooor rah! If I found a new 100 lb. thrust electric I would be over the moon as mine is pooched, and then probably feel guilty because it's not in the budget, but it wouldn't be going back, that's a for shue.  What would be something you would be very blown away to find?  Last year after Christmas I think there was a thread showing the fishing stuff and I was amazed at some of the goodies I saw. Santa was good to many lucky and deserving fishermen and one fisherwomen last year for sure.
I tried but can't really think of anything, I guess I'm happy with the old stuff I have.  I've always wanted a Wrangler 2 door, but like you said, that doesn't fit under the tree
A one man flip over would be mine. I'd be over the moon.  G
Finding a motor under the tree would be awesome.  As long as its a four stroke lol.  Nothing less or shes taking it back.
And you would be sleeping on the couch lol
Are those radio controlled boats have 4 strokes? One of those motors will fit.

A little more than I would ever expect anyone to spend on me but my dream would be to see a Megabass Lin 10 zirconia Meteor under the tree. To me, that reel is more of a work of art than something I would want to fish with.
Honestly a gas auger I would love.  The manual auger is brutal especially if you decide to move.
A nice pair of boat whips would be a dream come true..

I googles that and this is what it said about it on the website,  機械美が際立つマシンカットテクノロジーで設計された、ハイトルクなベイトキャスティングリールの登場です。LIN 10 L/Rから定評のある武骨で堅牢な作りに加え、それとは裏腹なシルキーなドライブフィールを実現。驚異的な釣力にさらに磨きがかかり、10ポンドオーバーとのファイトでも主導権を渡しません。また無駄を極限までそぎ落とした仕様に進化しており、持ち重りを感じさせることはありません。 メガバスで最も人気のあるベイトリールのひとつIS79のハイギア仕様に対して、6.3：1のローギア比は、引き重り抵抗が大きいディープクランクやアラバマリグ、ヘビーウエイトのスピナーベイト、スイムベイトなどの使用に適しています。ビギナーからベテランまで幅広いアングラーにパワーゲームの醍醐味を味わっていただけます。  Translation,  Introducing a high torque bait casting reel designed with elegant machine cut technology. The uncouth and robust construction of the LIN10R/L is combined with a silky drive feel. With a further increase in performance, it has the ability to dominate 10 pounders and up in a struggle. The Zirconia Meteor has evolved into a stripped down lightweight design, with all extraneous elements removed from its construction. The low gear ratio of 6.3:1 is suited for the heavier pulling resistance of deep cranks, Alabama rigs, heavy weight spinner bait, swim bait and so forth. From beginners to veteran anglers, this reel will show you the true thrill of power games.  You have to love when the Japanese translate to English. I love it. A stripped down uncouth reel for the thrill of power games with extraneous elements removed.  It must be the Porsche of reels. I did see the Ferrari of reels,another Japanese reel that retails for around $4000.00 I think that has a built in computer complete with automatic drag and motor. Gotta get me a few of those babies, maybe next year.  I would be afraid to take them out of the house. But good choice.

All I seem to need is a pair of ice cleats and good gloves. My son has been very good at keeping his Dad well equipped with rods and reels.  That aside, I guess the best present would be an invite to another fishing lodge/camp north of the 17.

two things for me this year.  a new pair of skates and a new hockey stick.  sorry to break the mould fellas.  but all my ice gear is perfect as it is.  i wanna play some shinny more then anything else  oh also a nice ham and some beer. but not under the tree lol
a 3 or 5 wt fly rod and reel would be awesome!
That 24 ft sylvan  hardtop up the road  would be sweet......   But I don't think it will happen till I get my taxes back.

I have a looooong list that would make me happy...  But this year we kept it small and got each other a few small gifts that are actually more thoughtful then most of the gifts we have ever bought each other...  The wife has been stealing my good thermos lately for coffee at work... So I got her a really nice little thermos for herself... Also she has hated her ice scrapper for her car for years but never replaced it... So I got her a new compact one that'll actually fit in her car on the floor... Her old one was too long...  I asked for a Canadian club gift kit with the 26er and 2 glasses... But that's not the real gift... The real gift is that bottle and 2 glasses is never to be touched by anyone but me... I don't drink much but some days at work make you crave a drink... And there's nothing worse then getting home at midnight to find your stash has been emptied...  With the amount of money I spend on fishing throughout the year I never ask for much... But she's good to get me a few little things... I'm sure I'll get socks... Underwear... Deodorant... Lip balm... Stuff like that so the kids don't think daddy got short changed by Santa... Lol
I love my new socks and underwear every year.     Honestly no sarcasm .   I haven't bought underwear in 15 years.
Not to hijack but.    But I'm glad they still make my Paul Coffey Sherwood That I played with as a kid. No way I'm buying a 200 dollar stick !

A new pair of waders for me! Last outing 3 weeks ago I found a second hole in my neoprenes, right below my crotch lol. I fished another 2 hours soaking wet and freezing and haven't been back out since   But other than that, my wife already gave me mine because I found it on sale last week. A new flux core welder   Nothing special, but just what I wanted...and for 1/2 price to boot!

A hitch for my car would be nice.  And in the 'impossible but would be great' category. A Rapala R-type left handed ice fishing bait cast combo (i have never seen them left handed and Chris K tells me they don't exsist'
I asked for a pop up hut and a new cordless drill I can run my auger with. Hopefully I was a good boy  S.
I asked for a pop up hut and a new cordless drill I can run my auger with. Hopefully I was a good boy  S.
A new 1 man Clam would be nice, a little easier on the heart than my Guide 2 man. Plus some luckier holes than I made last year
socks and underwear and some good hemp oil for medicinal purposes.
already asked for the following  Ice fishing Rod 1000 Series Reel Ice fishing Tip ups   lets see if my family delivered lol. update soon! ...aka next week

A telescopic rod, that I can pack in the suitcase, when we go down to St Lucia this January. I accidentally   left a printout of the one that crappy has, on the kitchen table; the next morning it was gone??? LOL  Dan.
